form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Received; read twice and referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs

form.official-title: To Amend title 38, United States Code, to direct the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to disapprove courses of education offered by a public institution of higher learning that does not charge the in-State tuition rate to a veteran using certain educational assistance under title 10 of such Code, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Montgomery GI Bill Selected Reserves Tuition Fairness Act of 2025.

section.header: Department of Veterans Affairs disapproval of courses offered by public institutions of higher learning that do not charge veterans in-state tuition rate for purposes of selected reserve educational assistance program

subsection.text: Subsection (c) of section 3679 of title 38, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (1), by inserting , or chapter 1606 of title 10, after chapter 30, 31, 33, or 35 of this title;
in paragraph (2), by adding at the end the following new subparagraph:

subparagraph.text: An individual who is entitled to assistance under section 16131 of title 10.

paragraph.text: in paragraph (6), by inserting , or chapter 1606 of title 10 before the period at the end.

subsection.text: Subsection (e) of such section is amended—

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (A), by inserting , or chapter 1606 of title 10, after chapter 31, 33, or 35 of this title; and
in subparagraph (B), by striking chapter 31 33, or 35 of this title and inserting chapter 31, 33, or 35 of this title, or chapter 1606 of title 10; and

paragraph.text: in paragraph (2), by striking chapter 31 33, or 35 of this title and inserting chapter 31, 33, or 35 of this title, or chapter 1606 of title 10.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall take effect on the date of the enactment of this Act and shall apply with respect to an academic period that begins on or after August 1, 2026.

attestation-group.attestation-date: Passed the House of Representatives April 7, 2025.
